Text.Value: Go rejoin the others, kid.
Leave.
*Grunt.*
This door is staying shut - just be sensible and leave!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: Come on now, open up! There's people out here who need shelter.
There's no shame in ensuring the sanctity of this grove. Now leave!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: We've been more than generous already! We have to take care of the grove's future.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: I said go away. You people have endangered this sacred place long enough.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: Move away.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: What's going on here?
You're a disgrace to this sacred grove. You should wither with shame.
Coward. Innocents are going to die, thanks to you.
*Grunt.*

EditorData.NodeContext: resigned grunt - has been asking for help from the druids and feels abandoned

Text.Value: You people have endangered the grove for long enough. Go away!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: Then this sacred grove can be a comfort to them in their final moments.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: *Grunt.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera pans down to show Doni, Player and the Door
EditorData.NodeContext: Worried grunt as he greets the player - trying to communicate a hopeless situation

Text.Value: This door is staying closed until you're gone, one way or another.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: Go away! There's nothing in here for you - for any of you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.
EditorData.NodeContext: Urgent, a little frightened even. This voice is supposed to be the same as Marcoryl, one of the druid servants.

Text.Value: But this door is staying closed. Now leave!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: You're wasting your time. This door is staying shut.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the door is seen - voice is OS

Text.Value: Leave.

Synopsis:
NOTE: the 'lair door' speaker is supposed to be Marcoryl, one of the druid servants (though he is unseen throughout, behind a locked door)
Doni the grunting tiefling kid stands by the sealed entrance to the druid lair. A voice from with warns both player and Doni away. It becomes apparent that the druid servants have sealed themselves in the inner sanctum before asn impending goblin attack, Efforts by the player to get them to open the sanctum to others fail  - the servants just want to ensure their own safety.
